website_summaries.verdict: A well-constructed and stylish choice that stands out because of its heavy duty design and durability over time.
pros: Consumers report that this drying rack is solid, durable, and attractive
Some who have used it for months praise it ability to stand up to even daily use over time
We love that it can handle heavier items and has an easy to use, space-saving design
cons: Although the unit states it can be for indoor or outdoor use, some users report it doesn't hold up as well when used outdoors
A few also felt the installation instructions could use improvement

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product - But Read This before you install!
customer_reviews.text: I love the product. Very well built and very sturdy. Caution when hanging though, here are a few tips: 1) The template did not exactly match the mounting bracket. It was off about 3/16". Before drilling, put the unit on top of the template and mark through the holes in the mounting bracket. 2) If you are going into drywall, not a stud, use the toggle anchors that come with the package. Don't use the flimsy plastic anchors. 3) Add stainless steel washers - especially in the bottom two holes. It needs them.
customer_reviews.author: SinginJimmy

customer_reviews.title: Decluttered our laundry room
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect solution for ridding the laundry room of a cumbersome drying rack, always in the way when in use. Four stars would be five if mounting holes were spaced to drill into studs. We had to mount it to wood drilled into the studs. A pine stair step purchased from our local home improvement store was the perfect size. We painted it to match the walls. The rack is very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy E.

customer_reviews.title: Oversized rack for undersized laundry room but made it work
customer_reviews.text: This is a really high quality product, well worth the money ($60 when I bought it). It is large, easily holding a lot in terms of both quantity and weight. Since my laundry room is tiny, we inverted the rack and installed it above a doorway, using a step stool (also from Amazon!) to access it -- see photos. My husband, as always, ignored the template and directions yet easily installed it (without disassembling it) in less than 15 minutes including the time it took to grab some extra toggle bolts for security. One nice thing about installing over a doorway was that the studs were placed precisely right, which is hit-or-miss elsewhere in this 50 year old house.
customer_reviews.author: Smidget

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Rack for Your Laundry Room
customer_reviews.text: Well designed, sturdy and made with high quality materials. The perfect rack to mount in your small laundry room to air dry the delicate clothes you don't want to put through the dryer. Also the perfect size (32") to mount in walls with studs on 16" centers. We mounted ours high so we could leave it extended all the time. We use it every day.
customer_reviews.author: RAS

customer_reviews.title: Great product, it works very well and it looks ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product, it works very well and it looks very stylish. I have my cloth rack on my laundry and it helps me to hang wet clothes and while I am not using it I can just push it back and it doesn't occupy any space. I chose this rack over other because it looks stylish and is made of quality material. The costumer service was great as well.
customer_reviews.author: Javier D.

customer_reviews.title: Use boxes to support!
customer_reviews.text: This really is a 2-person job to install these racks. BUT if you use boxes to support the rack while you are installing them, it goes MUCH easier. I found a stud in a decent place and was able to use wood screws down the one side of each rack. The toggle bolt anchors can be off-putting to use (you have to drill a massive hole in the wall first) but once installed they are sturdy. If the rack had been designed with a keyhole instead of just a round hole for mounting it would have been easier, but the boxes made that not such a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Trish B

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, lots of drying space, go straight into stud
customer_reviews.text: These holes are not exactly 32" apart but will go into 16 inch studs; you have about 3/4" on either side of middle of stud for wiggle room. I used a magnetic stud finder found here on amazon for 8 bucks:  When you get your 4 holes marked out use a 3/32" drill bit to make sure you're into the stud then drill a hole with 9/64" to accomodate the enclosed screws. Like butter. Never saw a template (could be part of the box) but just use the actual hanger as your template (some commented here that the template is off). Sturdy and easy to pull out, provides lots of drying space.
customer_reviews.author: bison_burger

customer_reviews.title: Tons of drying space but stores very compactly!
customer_reviews.text: I've had drying racks before. This is a whole different level of sturdiness and convenience. I first bought this for one of my Airbnbs and I was so pleased I now own 5. Drying racks, not Airbnbs. Each 6 bedroom vacation rentals has 2 and I have one in my home. They save me tons of dryer time processing towels. I especially like that they fold up super fast so that when you're not using then they don't take up tons of space or lots of time putting them away.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila Mc

customer_reviews.title: Decent product, crappy instructions and mounting hardware
customer_reviews.text: Good product, but instructions for installation were terrible. Wasn’t clear how to use mounting materials. If I did end up using them correctly, then the mounting materials were also bad. The mechanism (I think) depends on the hole that you drill being very snug bc the anchor expands only a couple of millimeters. This would have been fine, except instructions didn’t tell you what size drill bit to use. Ended up using a regular screw and anchor from my own collection.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Template is not accurate
customer_reviews.text: The holes in the template are not aligned to the holes in the rack. I am fairly annoyed at the 4 extra holes I have to fill, paint, and the new ones I have to drill. That will teach me to assume that anyone ever does their job correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Kostya Kortchinsky

customer_reviews.title: Decent rack for the money but filthy.
customer_reviews.text: If you don’t know how to install things in walls then you should hire someone to do it. I agree the hardware is crap which goes for about 90% of anything you buy. Any handyman/woman knows to use their own weight specific hardware. Easy to install and seems solid. It was really dirty and greasy from whatever plant it was made. Had to thoroughly wipe it down before adding my wife’s delicates. See images.
customer_reviews.author: Politicking

customer_reviews.title: Keeps our suits & pool towels dry and all in one place!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for to keep our suits and pool towels all in one place, easily accessible, yet out of the way! Stainless steel construction feels sturdy and heavy duty. Installation was easy: we used a molly on one side and the other side screwed it right into a stud. Slight bummer that it can't be extended easily with one hand, but it's just too wide of a rack for that - you need to pull on each side simultaneously (no big deal).
customer_reviews.author: Sj773Top Contributor: Gardening

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Drying Rack
customer_reviews.text: The rack just arrived, so this review is based upon its initial use. Just hung out the first load of hand washing, and I'm very pleased. I was looking for something more like what I used at beaches in other countries, but couldn't find one so I bought this. I'm happy I did since it's much more substantial than what I thought I'd wanted. It's easy to use, too. It did arrive without hardware or instructions, so my husband had to buy that along with a piece of lumber so he could attach this to the deck at our cabin. I do plan to find someway to cover it for the winter given that we won't be using it then.
customer_reviews.author: Rosakins

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Well, we got ready to install this thing, and surprise, surprise, there are no instructions or hardware in the box. Which means that somebody obviously had it and returned it without those things, thanks a LOT. Although I’d also blame the warehouse, where someone should have been responsible for checking that sort of thing before shipping it out to some poor sucker, in this case ME! So I’d like to tell you how it works, but it will be a while yet before I know anything about that. I’m VERY unhappy right now.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Just past the return period and the rack won’t stay together. If your only drying needs are wash rags this is for you, otherwise avoid this product
customer_reviews.author: Heather Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Wish I would’ve gotten sooner!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace an over-the-door product I’ve been using for many years, since I got tired of needing to bend down to walk under drying clothes. Though I was able to install this by myself (& I am a minimally skilled DIYer) installation would have been easier with another pair of hands. The product seems durable and able to hold the stated weight limit. Also, it came with some nice hardware (toggle bolts & wood screws) and since I was able to attach this using a wall stud on both sides I did not have to use the toggle bolts (so I didn’t have to drill a 1/2 inch whole to fit the toggle bolts through).
customer_reviews.author: BayouTi

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy item but a pain to install
customer_reviews.text: So I just put this bugger up tonight. I'm giving it 4 starts overall. As a product, I'm happy to give it 5 starts (but I will come back and edit this in a while if it doesn't hold true). As for installation, 2 stars. I did not receive a template, the screw were unusable, and the directions were worse. Thankfully, I'm not totally inept with a drill. The main plus - and this is a huge one - is that the holes are spaced stud-length apart, so you should have no trouble getting into wood instead of worrying if it'll pull right through your drywall.
customer_reviews.author: Avi D. Schneier

customer_reviews.title: WORKS GREAT
customer_reviews.text: We had read all the reviews & decided to just assemble the way it stated with the drywall hooks & whatever was provided. It works great & i can hang everything i need to on it. I love how it is collapsible. Looks great too!
customer_reviews.author: EMY

customer_reviews.title: Great rack, box didn’t survive shipping.
customer_reviews.text: Love the rack but the box was not suitable for shipping. It arrived on the doorstep ripped open at one end. I was surprised the rack wasn’t damaged. However, all of the hanging hardware that was supposed to have been included was missing. Apparently it had fallen out when the box was ripped open. I liked the rack so much I went to the hardware store and purchased my own screws and drywall anchors. It would have been a pain to return it just because of the missing hardware and the new box might have just ripped open again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy & strong.
customer_reviews.text: I have it mounted outside on our fence & have used it daily since my hubby installed it. I love how sturdy it is, how it collapses nearly flat, good for outside. Handwashables, lingerie, bathing suits & towels. The only negative was when I opened the box it appeared used, the stainless was not shiny & new looking. The bars were a little sticky like there was tape on them previously.
customer_reviews.author: Facogirl

customer_reviews.title: It will rust. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: So this is a great rack as long as you don’t plan to have wet towels on it. I purchased this item specifically to dry wet towels in my laundry room. Basically just Pool towels and swimsuits. It was over my basin and it rusted. Who Wants a towel rack that rusts???
customer_reviews.author: Pastor

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for laundry room wall
customer_reviews.text: We just have it for a few weeks, but It went up easily (no template was included, so we had to just hold it up to the wall to measure and get it mounted), it seems quite sturdy, and really conserves space. Folds up and pulls out easily. It is stainless, looks good, and since we are using it Indoors I doubt it will ever rust.
customer_reviews.author: Yefayfeyah

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we needed
customer_reviews.text: Just set it up. Seems to be exactly what we needed. We are hiding them in a locker/bench cabinet. Had to tighten the screws on each rod but other than that no issues so far. Template made it easy to install. Haven't hung clothes on yet but they should be good. Extremely happy.
customer_reviews.author: Jxc241

customer_reviews.title: Well built and easy to install!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what we were looking for in this piece; strong construction, expandable when needed, retractable when not, and super easy to install. Only negative comment: do NOT trust the template provided for installation. The holes on the template did not align with the holes on the actual product. Other than that, we highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Jay T.

customer_reviews.title: Safe saving and durable
customer_reviews.text: I like that this will mount exactly on the wall studs. Unfortunately my utility room is small and it just didn’t work to hang on the studs since this is a bigger rack. So I mounted this on a board than I sanded and painted and then mounted onto the studs. We hang all our stuff from the pool on here and I can hang plenty of delicate clothes as well. Really happy with how this space saving rack has made my utility room very functional.
customer_reviews.author: jmoyer

customer_reviews.title: This was a good solution for our cramped laundry/mechanical room
customer_reviews.text: Needed a folding rack to temporarily hang damp towels awaiting the next washing machine load. This was a good solution for our cramped laundry/mechanical room. Installation was easy (lucky there were wall studs just where I wanted to mount the rack so I didn't have to mess with drywall anchors or some sort of bracing).
customer_reviews.author: PLN

customer_reviews.title: It's fine once you get it installed
customer_reviews.text: I had issues installing as the drywall anchors included did not actually work. For one, do not use the size drill bit they suggest in the instructions for the hole (it's too big) I lost one of the anchors because of this. Secondly, the anchors did not split when the screw was being screwed in, so they just got push threw the wall. We had to improvise, find a nice board, screw that to the stud and then screw the rack to the board. Now that it is up, it works, but I wouldn't recommend using the dry-wall anchors they provide or else you'll be left with holes in the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: Good and bad.  Dirty and scratched tubes from factory!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 2 of these. One of them worked as promised, the other was too dirty and scratched and I sent I back! I will try one more. Also, being stainless does not mean it will not rust if left outside in the weather.
customer_reviews.author: John Dillinger

customer_reviews.title: Poor installation quality
customer_reviews.text: For what this item costs, it should be made a lot better. It does seem to slide better and is heavy duty, but installation is anything but easy. The flange on the back bracket should be made much taller so that the installer is able to access the screws to mount the item. The screws provided are also low quality.
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Does what it claims; build quality OK, not great.
customer_reviews.text: Smoothness of extension leaves something to be desired. Not quite as expansive as I thought. Overall a decent product that I would recommend if you need a hanging solution. I recommend the toggle bolts for installation in drywall because I have serious doubts that a regular drywall insert would hold it when fully loaded.
customer_reviews.author: Brian T.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy product, but DON'T use the enclosed template!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, very sturdy and well built. But DO NOT USE the enclosed template to drill your holes. The holes on the template are off by about 1/2". I learned the hard way when I drilled giant holes to fit the butterfly toggles, only to discover it didn't line up with the holes in the mounting bracket. I've had to repair my wall and reinstall elsewhere, as there are no usable wall studs in the area I need to mount it.
customer_reviews.author: riceball262

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product, but you'll need your own wall anchors
customer_reviews.text: This is handy and durable with more space then it looks like it has to hang clothes on. It comes with two ways to mount it, and I can't say anything for the "butterfly" screws way, but the wall anchors just quickly crushed when I tried to hammer them in to the wall. Other than that, it's a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Chervenak

customer_reviews.title: Installation if more difficult than it appears
customer_reviews.text: Now that this rack is securely on my wall, I am very happy with this product as far as function. It is sturdy and pulls out easily with plenty of room to hang items. Installation was not easy. Our rack was hung on drywall, which requires the use of the provided toggle bolts. Without question, you need at least 2 people and don't underestimate how large the holes must be to fit the toggle bolt through the hole. The directions provided are not really clear. I suggest supplementing the provided instructions with an online video. That said, I would still recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Edward G Sawyer III

customer_reviews.title: Great solution!
customer_reviews.text: We live in a 55+ community which prohibits clotheslines. I have always enjoyed hanging our clothes outdoors and have missed this since moving in. We searched various solutions and decided on the Aero rack. My husband installed it on the side of our house, on the deck. The rack is inconspicuously positioned, so will not be noticed by our neighbors. Our only issue with the installation was in using the included template; the screw holes were not lined up correctly. I look forward to using the rack once warmer weather arrives.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: sturdy and compact
customer_reviews.text: I really like that it holds heavy jeans easily - and pulls out/retracts smoothly. So much better than the lightweight aluminum one my builder installed that pulled out of wall first time. Also do not have to fully extend if you dont want to.
customer_reviews.author: njwau

customer_reviews.title: Great for letting clothes air dry indoors
customer_reviews.text: We like to hang our clothes outside to dry during the summer to help minimize shrinking and save on power consumption. This lets us hang clothes year round, rain or shine and it is holding up wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: This does its job well. Has enough space to hang a load of wet laundry, and is sturdy enough to not fall off my wall. I like that it's collapsible too so you can hide it away when it's not in use.
customer_reviews.author: MissLyssa

customer_reviews.title: A must for smaller spaces.
customer_reviews.text: Love love love. I have no idea why I waited so long to get this. Easily mounted in a small laundry room. Hang wet clothes to dry. Shut the door and poof in the morning you have dry clothes. Best drying rack yet and I have had ever pop up one imaginable.
customer_reviews.author: Justus

customer_reviews.title: well built and nice looking
customer_reviews.text: I had a plastic rack before this one and it eventually broke. I do not see that happening with this one. It is very sturdy and well built. It also extends nicely so that the clothes have plenty of room between them. I am not afraid to hang towels and mattress pads on this one. Look forward to using this for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: CMR NYC

customer_reviews.title: Handy and very usable
customer_reviews.text: Hung this on my bathroom wall over the tub. Works great and folds up small so it's not in the way. It's going to work great.
customer_reviews.author: Jill K

customer_reviews.title: Very Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Looks good, high quality, the distance between mounting holes is not 32" as between studs. I used a concrete drill bit to make a new hole in the bracket. Regular drill bits are not hard enough to make a hole.
customer_reviews.author: ETA

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Everyone needs this in their laundry room!! So handy. Although it retracts, I never retract it because I have so many items that cannot be put in dryer. Love the stainless steel look. Have had it for 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Steve & Linda

customer_reviews.title: space saving,good quality
customer_reviews.text: it was very easy to install. I was not attaching it to studs,,so I used the butterfly anchors provided. you will need a 1/2 inch drill bit,but don't worry,the holes will be covered by the support brackets..The rack is well made,and quite sturdy.It fold flat against the wall,a definite upgrade from typical drying racks.
customer_reviews.author: hilldale guy

customer_reviews.title: precious floor space saved!
customer_reviews.text: This wall mounted dryer rack is taking the place of a free standing rack, which took up too much floor space. Installation was only moderately difficult with two people involved. The unit feels sturdy so far (though I don't expect to hang 60 lbs. on it) and it is a great addition to the laundry room. We installed it high enough up on the wall to still have lots of storage underneath. Though the box was open when delivered, all of the parts were intact and the unit was not damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Low stainless steel quality. Rust after 6 months. Do NOT use outside.
customer_reviews.author: T Grupe

customer_reviews.title: Space saving and sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: We moved to a one bedroom apartment and my wife complained that she didn't have anywhere to hang dry her numerous dresses after a wash. I wanted something compact that we wouldn't have to bury in a closet and unfold each time. This fit the bill perfectly. It was easy to install and is surprisingly sturdy - the material is more heavy duty than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Shep C. James

customer_reviews.title: After installation - Very nice
customer_reviews.text: We have only had it up for a couple of days. So far - very nice. Collapses easily, pulls out to extension easily. Appears sturdy enough for our uses. We can't comment on durability yet, but it appears well made.
customer_reviews.author: Just Bob

customer_reviews.title: Expandable drying rack
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product for a small laundry room. Mounted it into the wall frame/studs and it's very sturdy. Holds a lot of laundry meant for air dry. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Batman

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: This product is great!!! A lifesaver!!!! We use it to dry shirts we choose not to dry. I also put shirts on hangers and put these on the rack as well. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Roper

customer_reviews.title: Strudy and an easy installation
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for and didn't know it. During my recent move my portable drying rack broke. While I used it for years it wasn't sturdy. My friend showed me her drying rack and I said 'I need that'! I'm a recent widow and was able to install it myself (my husband taught me a few tricks using an awl) so if you are handy it was an easy install. Other neighbors have seen the rack and were impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Ann Reese

customer_reviews.title: The perfect laundry/bathroom accessory
customer_reviews.text: I live in a very VERY small house, and im ok with that, but if there was one thing that made me go crazy was having towels hanging from chairs, doors etc etc, this product made a huge improvement in my home, it fitst very well all the towels used throughout the day and the product quality its the best, you can feel that it was made to last.
customer_reviews.author: Fabiola Avila

customer_reviews.title: Great except for installation materials
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome except for the materials to install it. I'm just praying it doesn't fall off of the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: The rack arrived the other day. I mounted it on the wall in the laundry room this afternoon. The stainless steel finish is sharp and the folding mechanism works well. The rack collapses to a fairly low profile when not in use. So far so good. Will report back after we use it for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Dog Doc

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction and great functionality.
customer_reviews.text: Really solid product that does what it says. Seems to be a commercial quality product at a consumer price. Not flimsy or cheap like many other racks, particularly ones that are mostly plastic. Should last for years of use without problem. If anything it seems over-engineered for the task.
customer_reviews.author: Eusmlle1

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Instructions
customer_reviews.text: Good product, but good luck with the instructions. This isn't hard to put up if you have a little bit of handyman in your blood, but if you don't, please don't rely on the instructions. Full of typos and terribly unhelpful. 10+ steps and not clear at all. Other than that, product works great!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Campobasso

customer_reviews.title: listen to other reviews and you'll be happy.
customer_reviews.text: This really organized the pool towels and drying. Thanks to the helpful reviews, we did not use the template for mounting... just the rack itself. it was also good to know the rack rods would need to be cleaned first. it did take several wipe downs to get the grey residue off the bars. super sturdy and very happy with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed,
customer_reviews.text: The Aero wall clothes drying rack is excellent for maximizing drying space in my laundry room. There are cheaper products on the market but chose this one because it is all stainless steel, can hold up to 60 lbs wet clothes. It is installed in a hallway but high enough at we don't bump our heads walking past, but can still reach to hang up laundry. Wish we found it years ago, highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our laundry room!
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves it! Quality is great! Perfect for our laundry room. Just what we needed to get the wet clothes off of our washer and dryer.
customer_reviews.author: Roy

customer_reviews.title: Well made !
customer_reviews.text: I had to have a handyman install cause it's a bit difficult mounting it on drywall. Took a bit of time. But I love the rack. Looks great. My only wish was that it extended completely. It only goes as far as you see in the pic.
customer_reviews.author: PENNYMH

customer_reviews.title: Perfect in laundry room
customer_reviews.text: This product is perfect hanging in our laundry room. It's a convenient size, and we love how it expands to hold lots of laundry, and retracts when not in use. It has held up great for the many months we've had it, without rusting, and still moves easily.
customer_reviews.author: Ed and Margaret

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality product. I needed something for the laundry room for clothes on hangers as well as to air dry delicates, and this fit the bill perfectly. It came with a cardboard template so that the mounting holes were accurately positioned, and the width was perfect: 32", which precisely spans the wall studs on 16" centers. Well thought out design and very good mounting instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Stealthnurse

customer_reviews.title: So convenient!
customer_reviews.text: We hung this on the wall in the laundry room, it closes perfectly so that we can open the closet door when we are not using it, yet stretches to hold an entire washing machine of hang dry clothes! Buy it!
customer_reviews.author: ddjdallas

customer_reviews.title: You’ll love this!
customer_reviews.text: This drying rack is awesome. It is very well made and so handy. I had one installed in my previous house and it was one of the first things I had installed in my new home. I can’t do laundry without it. You’ll love it!
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Works as advertised. Watch out for the metal edges. You can feel that the edges were not filed so they are very sharp. I sliced my finger on it. Other than that, great product.
customer_reviews.author: R. B.

customer_reviews.title: Attractive and strong.
customer_reviews.text: This rack replaced a free standing rack that just took up space in our laundry room, 95% of the time. It comes with a nice template and a variety of fasteners that makes installation a breeze. It looks great and is quite sturdy, even fully extended. We use it as a second folding shelf too. Pretty awesome!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. G

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: WE BOUGHT TWO. WE USED HEAVY DUTY SCREWS AND MOUNTED THEM TO A BOARD ON TOP OF DRY WALL FOR EXTRA STRENGTH.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: package arrive very damaged but product inside was fine
customer_reviews.text: easy to install, good looking and feels durable. Its very big so make sure you measure the space before buying
customer_reviews.author: simona cianciulli

customer_reviews.title: good quality
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and it will last as long as installed correctly. if you just put roles on drywall it ill fall. need to be mounted on studs,that is just common sense but i think it is always worth mentioning the obvious on these reviews,
customer_reviews.author: Cristina Souza-Piranio

customer_reviews.title: I love this rack!
customer_reviews.text: After draping clothes over the side of bathtubs, sinks, and shower rods, I've finally found a space saving rack where I can dry everything at the same time, in the same place. This thing is sturdy and doesn't transfer any color. No worries here. I'm glad I found it! Read the instructions completely to save yourself from contortionism on the install.
customer_reviews.author: CatWalk70

customer_reviews.title: Well-made, easy to install. Totally worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had a bunch of the freestanding drying racks at fold like this. This one costs more and is by far the best. All the others fall apart. Well-made, easy to install. Once folded, it’s nice and compact, and out-of-the-way. Stainless steel is great. It won’t mark or damage clothes.
customer_reviews.author: erich

customer_reviews.title: Great space-saver
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for awhile now. I needed somewhere to hang dry clothes in my new house. I love that this is up off of the floor, and it doesn't take up much space when contracted. My husband was worried because we had to use drywall anchors to put it through our (very old) sheetrock, but it has held up wonderfully, even under the weight of wet quilts. I'd buy this again if I had a need to!
customer_reviews.author: Amber Biggs

customer_reviews.title: Functional and beautiful
customer_reviews.text: We bought this clothes rack for our new laundry room a month ago and are very pleased with it. It expands and closes easily and it looks great. The design is truly elegant.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Awald

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Had a similar drying racking in my previous home which worked great. This one is much much sturdier. You will be very happy with it's durable construction. I was able to mount one side directly into the wall studs and use E-Z anchors (my preference) for mounting the other side. Wished the mounting holes lined up with the wall studs on both sides, but not a deal breaker. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and easy to install. I bought for my mom who was having trouble bending over whe using the standing rack. She started using it as soon as I mounted it.
customer_reviews.author: Lillian Cruz-Orengo

customer_reviews.title: Template is incorrect
customer_reviews.text: Overall a nice product. Mechanism functions well and it seems well made. Downsides were: 1) Glue failed on box and since it wasn't shipped in an over-pack,mounting hardware and instructions fell out of open box during shipping and were missing upon receipt. No big deal for me, but FYI 2) As other's have said, the supplied template doesn't line up with actual mounting holes. So don't use the template.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Mumm

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy product that will give you years of use.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this product twice. I have used the first one for two years and the product is in great shape and still going strong. Installation is pretty straight forward and they include a template to make drilling the holes a breeze. Product feels very sturdy and glides open and shut with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Bowling

customer_reviews.title: Laundry room must have!
customer_reviews.text: Love - love - love it. Used a free standing one of these for 20 years before this- love the compact size when it’s minimized and have been thinking about getting a second one for my laundry room!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Tomren

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, well made
customer_reviews.text: Nothing wrong with this except that it was too big or the spot I wanted it. Would love it if it were smaller.
customer_reviews.author: T. L. Wi

customer_reviews.title: Good product, wish it were bigger
customer_reviews.text: I have been wanting a clothes line but didn't have a great spot for one. I have a breeze way outside of my laundry area that gets a lot of sun and a nice breeze, great for drying clothes. I really like the rack. It is well made, sturdy and moves in and out easily. I only wish it were bigger. If I had two of them I could do a full load of towels.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy  schultz

customer_reviews.title: clean lines and good looking. Smooth operation
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected, clean lines and good looking. Smooth operation. The only comment I would make is that the instructions include the hold spacing. You recommend removing the mounting brackets for easier installation, but once removed it is difficult to measure the spacing if you did not measure before removing. Screws could be a little thicker for installation into a stud.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Install template was incorrect size
customer_reviews.text: So far so good but the installation template that shipped with the rack wasn't the correct size. Actually about two inches smaller which make no sense and ultimately was pretty frustrating as it slowed the install significantly. What should have taken 15 minutes (hold it up, level it, drill four holes drive in the screws, done) took an hour because of a piece of cardboard. The unit is fine but it cost me too much time on a Saturday so Four Stars is all I can give.
customer_reviews.author: M. Simmonds

customer_reviews.title: Up off the floor.
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed to help out with drying clothes. Another plus is that its on the wall and not on the floor. You can put a lot of clothes on this rack.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya

customer_reviews.title: Best investment for my laundry room
customer_reviews.text: I've seen wood laundry hangers for more than twice the price. And I hate those flimsy wood floor laundry hangers, they're always falling over. This product holds a lot, takes up no floor space, and the price is right.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend for this reason
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately holes were not 32" on center as one reviewer wrote - closer to 31.5". Very difficult to mount into studs in wall. Would not recommend for this reason.
customer_reviews.author: Purchaser in Michigan

customer_reviews.title: Tough and easy to operate.
customer_reviews.text: We have two of these. One holds heavy yoga mats between uses and shows no signs of the strain. The other is in the laundry room as a space saver. This rack is easy to operate and when installed correctly, very tough.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: As expected - arrived on time
customer_reviews.text: As expected - arrived on time. Unfortunately my measurements were off and I had to return. Completely bummed!
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Quality, but hard for custom jobs
customer_reviews.text: Holds clothes as advertised. We've used this multiple times and it holds up well under the weight of clothing. The transition between open and closed is seamless, and there is no bending of clothes with normal clothes like delicates/dark/white. The present holes did not line up with the studs in my house, but it is on a secpndary board that is attached to the studs. Expect that if you don't have the perfect stud arrangement.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: This is a good buy.
customer_reviews.text: I normally don't like to write reviews for Chinese made items but this rack is really well made. Very pleased with construction and looks. Also doesn't take up floor space.
customer_reviews.author: james bustle

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, great addition to the laundry room
customer_reviews.text: Is holding up well. My husband installed it, doubt I could have done it. We have it over our dryer in the laundry room, and use it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: wasscat

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Product
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product. Fairly easy to install, I would just caution that the anchors provided may not work if you're going directly into drywall. Per haps use a drill bit one size smaller than that recommended as mine went straight through when using the recommended size and I had to use other drywall anchors (thankfully on hand). It held up to two medium sized blankets with all bars between filled with other various clothes.
customer_reviews.author: MoreReview

customer_reviews.title: stury and useful
customer_reviews.text: this works great over the sink in my laundry room. I use it for drying my delicates and other things that I don't want to put in the dryer. I love the way that it folds up out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: lilredhood

customer_reviews.title: Excellent drying rack that stores out of the way
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Exactly what we need to hang all the towels and bathing suits at our Florida house. Easy to put up with materials provided. Seems very sturdy and moves easily in and out.
customer_reviews.author: janet donegan

customer_reviews.title: Good value, worth it. Solid
customer_reviews.text: Holds lots of clothes. I hang my undies inside and sheets outside on the line! This allows some privacy. It holds sweatshirts and jeans when I need it to. Mounted it to studs, its very sturdy. Easily 60 ft of space. It's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Dani

customer_reviews.title: Must have.
customer_reviews.text: This worked great. Put it on the basement wall cement with tapcons and I can put any amount of laundry on it.
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect addition to my laundry room!! I hang dry most of my items and needed something I could mount to the wall for air drying my pants! Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: maravs6

customer_reviews.title: heavy duty, hard to extend
customer_reviews.text: Looked to be well made, but was too heavy for me to mount off the deck as planned. Product itself would have done what I wanted though. I finally had to give it away
customer_reviews.author: Majay

customer_reviews.title: This is the perfect solution to the question
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect solution to the question, "Where do I hang my delicate clothes when the outside weather isn't permitting?" It installed pretty easily, and is sturdy enough to hold a fair number of my blouses, etc., on hangers or over the bars.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I previously hung air dry items on the door frame - not a good idea because it makes little markings on the door frame. When remodeling, I looked for something durable and attractive for my new laundry room. This is the perfect item - sturdy and contractor installed it without issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I just installed the rack a few days ago and used it today for the first time. I love it!! I took off one star because the instructions and mounting hardware were not included in the box. Luckily I had hardware to hang it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Durability
customer_reviews.text: Love this rack! We have two of them because they take up less space and you can collapse them when not doing laundry and they are out of the way. They are very durable and hold more than I ever thought. I absolutely love this rack and how durable it is!!
customer_reviews.author: Bette Groth

product_meta.title: AERO W Racks Stainless Steel Wall Mounted Collapsible Laundry Clothes Drying Rack 60 Pound Capacity 22.5 Linear Ft
feature_bullets: Helps dry your clothes and avoid all types of wrinkles when removing your clothes from the dryer.
It’s equivalent to having 22 feet of linear hanging line. Lowers your energy bill by reducing your clothes dryer use.
Very sturdy and durable (made of stainless steel and can hold up to 60lbs of clothes)
Helps you keep your clothes and other objects neatly organized and it’s really easy to use.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars825 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
